data.title: Salesforce Administrator at Foundation for California Community Colleges
data.meta_description:
Functional Title: Salesforce Administrator
CALPERS Title: Senior Associate 
Department: Business Systems
Reports To:  Associate Director, Business Systems   

FLSA Status: Exempt		
Primary Work Location: 100% Remote within California
Last Updated: 4/8/2022			
Flex Work Option: Yes

Position Summary

Under the direction of the Associate Director, Business Systems, and working cooperatively with the entire Business Systems team, the Salesforce Administrator will be the principal subject matter expert while leading maintenance, strategic enhancements, feature evaluation and implementation, user acceptance testing, technical project implementation, integration efforts, and advanced user support. 

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities
Salesforce Administration and Maintenance:
•	Works with the Business Systems and leadership teams to ensure efficient and effective use of Salesforce for multiple departments, projects, and external clients.
•	Manage and maintain Salesforce platform, including, but not limited to: 
o	Salesforce Administration (regular maintenance of CRM) including account maintenance, case management, reports and dashboards, workflows, development and management of Experiences, and other routine tasks.
o	Data management, including deduplication, report maintenance, security checks/alerts, optimization, and data import/export tasks.
o	Updating Profiles and Permission sets.
o	Object/field review and clean up.
o	Development and maintenance of Salesforce administration documentation, while supporting change management specialist in user documentation.
o	Evaluate and install new Salesforce releases, recommending new features and summarizing changes that will impact users.  
•	Development projects including but not limited to:
o	Salesforce development, including field and object creation and maintenance, automation requests.
o	Support the integration and implementation of third-party applications.
o	Implementing a data backup strat  Celebrating over 20 years of service to the California Community Colleges.

The Foundation is on a mission to double its impact by 2028. Guided by the California Community Colleges' ambitious Vision for Success, our projects and services seek to be at the forefront of innovation and excellence in higher education across five areas of impact: student success, workforce development, equity, community impact, and system support.

We are proud of the pivotal role we play in forging new partnerships and accelerating bold approaches to advance the California Community Colleges and the communities they serve.

About the Employer

Celebrating over 20 years of service to the California Community Colleges. The Foundation is on a mission to double its impact by 2028. Guided by the California Community Colleges' ambitious Vision for Success, our projects and services seek to be at the forefront of innovation and excellence in higher education across five areas of impact: student success, workforce development, equity, community impact, and system support. We are proud of the pivotal role we play in forging new partnerships and accelerating bold approaches to advance the California Community Colleges and the communities they serve.
